helpgrid.innerhtml: Specify your first, second, and third choice calendars to use for calculating target values.
The SLA will be applied to a ticket or work order if all of the conditions are met.

section.description: You can specify classification criteria for this SLA, select the internal priority operator (such as EQUAL, GREATER, or LESS), and enter a priority value. If you specify criteria, the ticket or work order must meet these conditions to apply the SLA.
section.label: SLA Criteria

table.description: You can select the service group or services to which this SLA applies. The ticket or work order must reference one of the items specified in order to apply the SLA.
table.label: Included Services

table.description: You can click Add First Row to select existing structured conditions that compare fields and enable you to select records based on the result. The ticket or work order must meet these conditions in order to apply the SLA.
table.label: Conditions

section.description: Click Maximize Additional SLA Criteria Section to write your own SQL conditions, or use the SQL Expression Builder to build expressions.
section.label: Additional SLA Criteria

helpgrid.innerhtml: The SLA will be applied to a ticket or work order if all of the conditions are met.

table.description: You can select the locations or location hierarchies for this SLA or leave these fields blank to apply the plan to all records with any locations or location types.
table.label: Location and Location Hierarchies

helpgrid.innerhtml: The SLA will be applied to a ticket or work order if all of the conditions are met.

table.description: You can select the assets or asset types for this SLA, or leave these fields blank to apply the plan to all records with any assets or asset types.
table.label: Asset Type and Assets

helpgrid.innerhtml: The SLA will be applied to a ticket or work order if all of the conditions are met.

include.description: You can select the configuration items for this SLA or leave these fields blank to apply the plan to all records with any configuration items.

helpgrid.innerhtml: Select Action Group or add individual actions by clicking New Row.

Associate customers with an SLA if you want the SLA to apply only to tickets or work orders for these customers. If you do not associate a customer with an SLA, it can be applied to any ticket or work order.
